00020 char *
00021 _trim(char *str)
00022 {
00023         char *ibuf, *obuf;
00024 
00025         if (str) {
00026                 for (ibuf = obuf = str; *ibuf; ) {
00027                         while (*ibuf && (isspace (*ibuf)))
00028                                 ibuf++;
00029                         if (*ibuf && (obuf != str))
00030                                 *(obuf++) = ' ';
00031                         while (*ibuf && (!isspace (*ibuf)))
00032                                 *(obuf++) = *(ibuf++);
00033                 }
00034                 *obuf = '\0';
00035         }
00036         return (str);
00037 }

00045 char *
00046 _strtok(char **holder, char *s, const char *delim)
00047 {
00048         if (s)
00049                 *holder = s;
00050 
00051         return (strsep(holder, delim));
00052 }

00054 /*
00055  * Similar to sprintf but creates and calculates buffer automatically.
00056  * Formatted string is saved into buffer to which is pointed filledstr.
00057  * Buffer can be dealocated by free function.
00058  * @param format must contain not other than "%s" formating strings.
00059  * \return length of formatted string.
00060  */
00061 size_t
00062 _sprintf(int num, char **filledstr, const char *format, ...)
00063 {
00064         va_list ap;
00065         const char *curarg;
00066         size_t argln = strlen(format);
00067         int argcnt = num;
00068 
00069         va_start(ap, format);
00070         while (num-- > 0) {
00071                 curarg = va_arg(ap, const char *);
00072                 argln += strlen(curarg);
00073         }
00074         va_end(ap);
00075 
00076         argln = argln - argcnt * 2;
00077         (*filledstr) = malloc(argln + 1);
00078 
00079         va_start(ap, format);
00080         if (vsprintf((*filledstr), format, ap) != argln) {
00081                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR
00082                                 "sprintf bad length"
00083                                 " in %s:%d\n", __FILE__, __LINE__);
00084                 // return (-1);
00085         }
00086         va_end(ap);
00087 
00088         (filledstr)[argln] = '\0';
00089 
00090         return (argln + 1);
00091 }

00096 void
00097 strtoprot(char *str, protocols* prots)
00098 {
00099         if ((strlen(str) == 0) || (strcmp(str, PROTOCOL_HTTP) == 0)) {
00100                 *prots = HTTP;
00101                 return;
00102         }
00103 
00104         if (strcmp(str, PROTOCOL_FTP) == 0) {
00105                 *prots = FTP;
00106                 return;
00107         }
00108 
00109         *prots = UNKNOWN;
00110 }

00116 size_t
00117 _strnlen(const char *str, size_t maxlen)
00118 {
00119         const char *end = memchr(str, '\0', maxlen);
00120         return (end ? (size_t) (end - str) : maxlen);
00121 }

00127 char *
00128 _strndup(char *str, size_t num)
00129 {
00130         size_t len = _strnlen(str, num);
00131 
00132         char *buf = malloc(sizeof (char) * (len + 1));
00133         if (buf == NULL)
00134                 return (NULL);
00135 
00136         buf[len] = 0;
00137 
00138         return (memcpy(buf, str, num));
00139 }

00145 int
00146 link_parse(char *linkstr, lnk *link)
00147 {
00148         int status;
00149         regex_t re;
00150         char *protocol;
00151         size_t rquriln;
00152         int matchsize = 8;
00153         regmatch_t match[matchsize];
00154 
00155         if (regcomp(&re, LINK_REGEXP, REG_EXTENDED) != 0) {
00156                 // error
00157                 fprintf(stdlog, "NOT COMPILED\n");
00158                 return (-1);
00159         }
00160         status = regexec(&re, linkstr, (size_t) 8, match, 0);
00161         regfree(&re);
00162         if (status != 0) {
00163                 // error
00164                 fprintf(stdlog, log_ERROR "%s not valid http link!!!\n",
00165                                 linkstr);
00166                 return (-1);
00167         }
00168 
00169         protocol = _strndup(linkstr + match[1].rm_so,
00170                         (size_t) (match[1].rm_eo - match[1].rm_so));
00171         strtoprot(protocol, &link->prot);
00172 
00173         rquriln = (size_t) (match[3].rm_eo - match[3].rm_so);
00174 
00175         link->hostname = _strndup(linkstr + match[2].rm_so,
00176                         (size_t) (match[2].rm_eo - match[2].rm_so));
00177         if (rquriln == 0)
00178         link->rquri = URI_BASENAME;
00179         else
00180         link->rquri = _strndup(linkstr + match[3].rm_so, rquriln);
00181         link->filename = _strndup(linkstr + match[6].rm_so,
00182                         (size_t) (match[6].rm_eo - match[6].rm_so));
00183 
00184         free(protocol);
00185 
00186         return (0);
00187 }
00188 
00193 int
00194 match(const char *string, char *pattern)
00195 {
00196         int status;
00197         regex_t re;
00198 
00199         if (regcomp(&re, pattern, REG_EXTENDED|REG_NOSUB) != 0) {
00200                 // error
00201                 fprintf(stderr, "NOT COMPILED\n");
00202                 return (0);
00203         }
00204         status = regexec(&re, string, (size_t) 0, NULL, 0);
00205         regfree(&re);
00206         if (status != 0) {
00207                 // error
00208                 return (0);
00209         }
00210         return (1);
00211 }

00219 char *
00220 _strcat(const char *first, const char *second)
00221 {
00222         size_t fln = strlen(first);
00223         size_t sln = strlen(second);
00224         char *dest = malloc(fln + sln + 1);
00225 
00226         dest[fln + sln] = '\0';
00227         memcpy(dest + fln, second, sln);
00228         return (memcpy(dest, first, fln));
00229 }

00235 char *
00236 _strtr(char *str, char from, char to)
00237 {
00238         char *idx = str;
00239         for (; *(idx) != '\0'; ++idx) {
00240                 if (*idx == from)
00241                         *idx = to;
00242         }
00243         return (str);
00244 }
